str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Yesterday. Of uncertain derivation; 'yesterday'; by extension, in time past or hitherto.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
